metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13112 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A PngChunk::parseChunkContent uncontrolled memory allocation in Exiv2 through 0.27.1 allows an attacker to cause a denial of service (crash due to an std::bad_alloc exception) via a crafted PNG image file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13112` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exiv2 - 0.25-2.1ubuntu16.04.4
libexiv2-14 - 0.25-2.1ubuntu16.04.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: exiv2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.25-2.1ubuntu16.04.4').
